snippet: A former manager of a Singapore-based company servicing United States Navy ships was sentenced to more than five years in prison.
abstract: Federal judge sentences Alex Wisidagama, former manager of Glenn Defense Marine Asia, Singapore-based company servicing United States Navy ships, to more than five years in prison for fraud scheme that overbilled Navy; orders Wisidagama to pay more than $34 million in restitution.
lead_paragraph: A former manager of a Singapore-based company servicing United States Navy ships was sentenced to more than five years in prison.

headline.main: California: 5-Year Prison Term in Navy Bribery Case
headline.print_headline: California: 5-Year Prison Term in Navy Bribery Case
